root: ^You're walking down a familiar path, enjoying the sounds of birds chirping and the trees rustling slightly in the wind.
^After a short while of walking, you spot a strange figure in the distance.
^Despite it being a good bit taller than you, it doesn't seem very imposing due to the way it moves.
^As you get even closer, you start to understand why this figure seems to struggle with moving.
^...You're unsure if you should see their pretentiousness as insulting or endearing. But you want to do something about this.

s: ^Your generous offer of an apple seems to garner the respect of the

b: ^ Better to have friends than enemies after all.
^ kobolds. This has gone too far!
^ shady figure. No one calls you chip!

s: ^You attempt to strike up a conversation with

b: ^ You've had enough of these three.

s: ^You firmly grip the frying pan and swing straight at
^You grip the staff with both hands, and swing straight at
^You offer a healing potion to the

b: ^ kobolds, hoping to demonstrate that you mean no harm.
^ shady figure. Perhaps that'll gain you some respect.
^"I accept your generous offer, chip. Good luck on your travels."
^The figure resumes its laborous walking, eventually fading into the distance
^"Whoa, thanks a bunch! We'll totally try to remember this!"
^The three kobolds hop off of each other, before continuing on their way. Seems they forgot their coat.
^As you call forth a bonfire, the shady figure stumbles back a few steps.
^Seeing its uncertainty, you take out some marshmallows to hopefully pique its interest. No, wait.
^You were meant to roast the figure, not some marshmallows!
^As you ponder what exactly went wrong, the shady figure shifts around strangely.
^You hear strange bickering from inside the shady figure, which quickly ends as...
^The coat covering the figure falls off, revealing three kobolds stacked on top of each other.
^Well now that our great secret is revealed, nothing's stopping us from having the marshmallows, right?
^The red one lets out an exasperated sigh.
^You call forth a bonfire between you and the figure, taking out some marshmallows.
^You hear strange bickering from within the figure, as it shifts around strangely.
^The bickering quickly stops, as the coat covering the figure falls off, revealing a stack of three kobolds.
^Well now that our great secret is revealed, nothing's stopping us from having the marshmallows, right?
^The red one lets out an exasperated sigh.
^As you call forth a bonfire, the kobold stack stumbles back a few steps.
^Seeing their uncertainty, you take out some marshmallows to hopefully pique its interest. No, wait.
^You were meant to roast the kobolds, not some marshmallows!
^As you ponder what exactly went wrong, the white kobold voices their opinion.
^"The hat already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows it offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"The wizard lady already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows she offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"This wizard guy already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows he offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"The wizard-person already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows they offer wouldn't change anything!"
^The red one lets out an exasperated sigh.
^You call forth a bonfire between you and the kobolds, taking out some marshmallows.
^The three bicker quietly for a moment, before the white kobold voices their opinion.
^"The hat already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows it offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"The wizard lady already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows she offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"This wizard guy already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows he offers wouldn't change anything!"
^"The wizard-person already knows our great secret, taking the marshmallows they offer wouldn't change anything!"
^The red one lets out an exasperated sigh.
^"I suppose. I'm far too busy to stay for a chat, however. Keep walking, chip", the figure says while lumbering away.
^"What a weirdo", you think to yourself while watching the figure grow distant.
^You and the kobold stack both shuffle awkwardly.
^"Good talk", you say while already walking away to escape the awkwardness.
^"You too", a kobold replies before you hear a slap behind you.
^What a horribly awkward encounter. Hopefully they'll also try to forget about it.
^The lockpick is swatted away as the red kobold bites your hand!
^The red kobold gives it a confused look.
^The figure bends strangely to inspect it, before straightening back up.
^You swing at the stack of kobolds, landing a few strikes on the middle one, who yelps out in pain!
^The stack quickly dismantles, and the other two rapidly carry off their wounded stack-mate.
^As the group is escaping, the red one yells out: "We'll definitely finish you off next time!"
^You swing at the stack of kobolds, landing a few strikes on the middle one, who yelps out in pain!
^"What the hell, lady!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, mister!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, hat!? What was that for?"
^The stack quickly dismantles, and the other two rapidly carry off their wounded stack-mate.
^As the group is escaping, the red one yells out: "We'll definitely mess you up next time!"
^You swing at the figure, and while you do land some strikes, the figure seems more scared than hurt.
^You quickly find out the reason, as the figure's coat slips off, revealing a very pissed off looking stack of kobolds!
^"What the hell, lady!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, mister!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, hat!? What was that for?"
^The kobolds growl at you. You seem to have a fight on your hands.

HANDLE_BONK_OUTCOME: ^Your strike connects with the head of
^ sounding like it hurt. A lot.

b: ^A fitting punishment for calling you chip, you think.
^The figure quickly falls apart, revealing three kobolds!
^"What the hell, lady!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, mister!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, hat!? What was that for?"
^The remaining two kobolds quickly pick up their wounded stack-mate, preparing to run off.
^"Point taken, now get the hell out of the way!"
^The two kobolds still standing sprint away from you while carrying the third.
^As they make their escape, the dark grey one yells at you: "We'll definitely mess you up next time!"
^The top kobold falls from atop the stack, unconscious. You can already see a bump forming on his head.
^"What the hell, lady!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, mister!? What was that for?"
^"What the hell, hat!? What was that for?"
^The remaining two kobolds quickly pick up their wounded stack-mate, preparing to run off.
^As the kobolds start to make their escape, the dark grey one yells at you: "We'll definitely mess you up next time!"
^The top kobold falls from atop the stack, unconscious. You can already see a bump forming on his head.
^The remaining two kobolds quickly pick up their wounded stack-mate, preparing to run off.
^As the kobolds start to make their escape, the dark grey one yells at you: "We'll definitely mess you up next time!"
^"I accept your generous offer, chip", the figure says while taking the offered potion.
^"I will remember this. Now keep walking, chip"
^You seem to have garnered the respect of the figure, who is now laborously walking away from you.
^"Wow, are you sure we can take this? Thanks a lot!"
^ We'll totally try to remember this!"
^The red kobold whispers something to the others, and they nod in unison.
^The three kobolds hop off of each other, before continuing on their way. Seems they forgot their coat.
^"Thanks again for the marshmallows, hat-thing! Good luck with the adventuring!" The group yells, their voices growing distant.
^"Thanks again for the marshmallows, kind lady! Good luck with the adventuring!" The group yells, their voices growing distant.
^"Thanks again for the marshmallows, mister! Good luck with the adventuring!" The group yells, their voices growing distant.
^"Thanks again for the marshmallows, wizard-person! Good luck with the adventuring!" The group yells, their voices growing distant.
^What a surprisingly nice group of kobolds. Even though the red one called you chip.
^You suppose there's nothing left to do here, and resume traveling.
^You suppose there's nothing left to do here, and resume traveling.
